docs.text: lsp-metals # Emacs Scala IDE using lsp-mode to connect to Metals . Quickstart # An example to setup lsp-metals using use-package : ( use-package lsp-metals :ensure t :custom ;; Metals claims to support range formatting by default but it supports range ;; formatting of multiline strings only. You might want to disable it so that ;; emacs can use indentation provided by scala-mode. ( lsp-metals-server-args ' ( "-J-Dmetals.allow-multiline-string-formatting=off" )) :hook ( scala-mode . lsp ))
